articles.headline: Fed Ties Rates to Joblessness, With Target of 6.5%
articles.snippet: Making it plain that job creation had become its focus, the Federal Reserve said it would suppress interest rates so long as unemployment stayed above a certain level.
articles.abstract: Making it plain that job creation had become its focus, the Federal Reserve said it would suppress interest rates so long as unemployment stayed above a certain level.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Federal Reserve made it plain on Wednesday that job creation had become its primary focus, announcing that it planned to continue suppressing interest rates so long as the unemployment rate remained above 6.5 percent.

articles.headline: 10 Arrested in Theft of Web Data
articles.snippet: Law enforcement officials were helped by Facebook, whose users were among those targeted by the software employed by cybercriminals in the last few years.
articles.abstract: Law enforcement officials were helped by Facebook, whose users were among those targeted by the software employed by cybercriminals in the last few years.
articles.lead_paragraph: International authorities, with some help from Facebook, have arrested 10 people accused of operating a network of infected computers that stole personal information from millions of victims.
articles.byline: By Brian X. Chen and John H. Cushman Jr

articles.headline: Study Shows a Pattern of Risky Loans by F.H.A.
articles.snippet: By ignoring risks in loans it insured in 2009 and 2010, the study says, the Federal Housing Administration is imperiling borrowers and taxpayers who stand behind the agency.
articles.abstract: By ignoring risks in loans it insured in 2009 and 2010, the study says, the Federal Housing Administration is imperiling borrowers and taxpayers who stand behind the agency.
articles.lead_paragraph: A new and extensive analysis of 2.4 million loans insured by the Federal Housing Administration in recent years shows a pattern of risky lending that could generate $20 billion in losses and harm thousands of the nation’s most vulnerable borrowers. By ignoring risks in loans it insured in 2009 and 2010, the study concludes, the F.H.A. is imperiling both borrowers and taxpayers who stand behind the agency.

articles.headline: Investors Stay Calm, if Cautious, as Stalemate Simmers
articles.snippet: Judging by the stock markets, investors aren’t too worried yet about the debate in Washington over impending tax increases and spending cuts.
articles.abstract: Judging by the stock markets, investors aren’t too worried yet about the debate in Washington over impending tax increases and spending cuts.
articles.lead_paragraph: Washington wonders what will happen. Wall Street thinks it already knows.

articles.headline: Millions in Ransoms Fuel Militants’ Clout in West Africa
articles.snippet: Kidnapping is such a lucrative industry for extremists that it has reinforced their control over northern Mali and complicated plans for a campaign to take back Islamist-held territory.
articles.abstract: Kidnapping is such a lucrative industry for extremists that it has reinforced their control over northern Mali and complicated plans for a campaign to take back Islamist-held territory.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAMAKO, Mali — Oumar Ould Hamaha, a notorious Islamist commander in the deserts of western Africa, has nothing but disdain for the international powers he opposes or the hapless Westerners he and other militants subject to extreme deprivation, hunger, thirst and proselytizing for months on end.

articles.headline: Canada Reviews Plans to Buy F-35 Fighter Jets
articles.snippet: After an estimate found that the sophisticated stealth planes would cost substantially more than the government had promised, the government said it would reconsider its plans.
articles.abstract: After an estimate found that the sophisticated stealth planes would cost substantially more than the government had promised, the government said it would reconsider its plans.
articles.lead_paragraph: Canada said Wednesday that it would reconsider plans to buy 65 F-35 fighter jets after an independent audit found that the sophisticated stealth planes would cost substantially more than the government had promised.
articles.byline: By Ian Austen and Christopher Drew

articles.headline: Drink Ingredient Gets a Look
articles.snippet: Use of brominated vegetable oil in foods, like fruit-flavored sodas, has long been allowed by federal regulators, but consumers have raised new concerns about the ingredient.
articles.abstract: Use of brominated vegetable oil in foods, like fruit-flavored sodas, has long been allowed by federal regulators, but consumers have raised new concerns about the ingredient.
articles.lead_paragraph: Sarah Kavanagh and her little brother were looking forward to the bottles of Gatorade they had put in the refrigerator after playing outdoors one hot, humid afternoon last month in Hattiesburg, Miss.

articles.headline: Portrayal of C.I.A. Torture in Bin Laden Film Reopens a Debate
articles.snippet: Critics, journalists and activists are divided over the suggestion that calculated infliction of pain and fear may have produced useful clues in hunt for Osama bin Laden.
articles.abstract: Critics, journalists and activists are divided over the suggestion that calculated infliction of pain and fear may have produced useful clues in hunt for Osama bin Laden.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Even before its official release, “Zero Dark Thirty,” the new movie about the hunt for Osama bin Laden, has become a national Rorschach test on the divisive subject of torture.

articles.headline: N. Joseph Woodland, Inventor of the Bar Code, Dies at 91
articles.snippet: Mr. Woodland helped conceive of a technology that helped revolutionize the retail industry and today graces nearly every surface of contemporary life.
articles.abstract: Mr. Woodland helped conceive of a technology that helped revolutionize the retail industry and today graces nearly every surface of contemporary life.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was born on a beach six decades ago, the product of a pressing need, an intellectual spark and the sweep of a young man’s fingers through the sand.

articles.headline: Maps App for iPhone Steers Right
articles.snippet: Google’s maps app for the iPhone offers smooth navigation and intelligent directions for driving, walking and public transportation.
articles.abstract: Google’s maps app for the iPhone offers smooth navigation and intelligent directions for driving, walking and public transportation.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was one of the biggest tech headlines of the year: in September, Apple dropped its contract with Google, which had always supplied the data for the iPhone’s Maps app. For various strategic reasons, Apple preferred to write a new app, based on a new database of the world that Apple intended to assemble itself.

articles.headline: U.S. Rejects Telecommunications Treaty
articles.snippet: After weeks of talks that often pitted Western governments against Russia, China and developing countries, the United States announced it would not sign the agreement.
articles.abstract: After weeks of talks that often pitted Western governments against Russia, China and developing countries, the United States announced it would not sign the agreement.
articles.lead_paragraph: DUBAI — Talks on a proposed treaty governing international telecommunications collapsed in acrimony on Thursday when the United States rejected the agreement on the eve of its scheduled signing, citing an inability to resolve an impasse over the Internet.
